channel.title: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)
channel.description:
Hey all, I'm trying to run a 317 ProjectInsanity based source on a linux vps running Debian (32-bit)
When I try and run my source via a modified run.sh I run into this: [img]http://gyazo.com/1282ea5366020124d5d29f4e409485ee.png[/img]
This shit's so confusing :c
Can anyone guide me in the right direction with this?

item.title: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

HcoJustin:

Make sure the classes are included in there. If they’re in bin make sure you include bin in the class path with all the libraries

Yes, they’re included in there, I see the Server.class inside the deps/data/CompiledFiles/server/
There is no bin folder, it just goes deps/data/CompiledFiles

Here is my current run.sh

[quote]
echo Loading up DankScape…
java -Xmx1300m -cp deps/data/CompiledFiles:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/RuneTopListV2.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server

Read full topic
item.source: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)

item.title: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

Now it’s saying
Loading up DankScape…
Error: Could not find or load main class server.Server
Any other suggestions ;D?

Read full topic

item.title: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

replace all ; with : and you don’t need one at the end of your last jar.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a PI-based source in linux (Debian)
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

HcoJustin:

Please give us the code in your shell script

echo Loading up DankScape…
screen -dmS rsps java -Xmx1300m -cp .;deps/data/CompiledFiles;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/RuneTopListV2.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

Read full topic
